0: Will you use a passcode on your device?
1: Will you use fingerprints and/or Face ID?
2: Will you keep passwords to yourself?
7: Ignore and/or block calls, texts, emails and messages from people we do not know
8: Do not click on pop-ups or links in games or apps
9: Do not create accounts on websites without your caregivers' permission
10: Create parent accounts when an app or website
11: Wait until age of 13 to create acccounts using child's information
12: Use apps and website that do not require accounts
13: Which ones will (CHILD) be allowed to use on their device?
14: Who will (CHILD) be allowed to talk to through their device?
15: Do you agree to talk to (ADULT) when this happens?
16: Do you promise to listen with an open mind and do your best to support (CHILD)?
17: What can child share with others online?
18: What can (ADULT) share with others on social media?
19: Do adults need to ask for permission from other family members before posting pictures or videos they are in?
20: If a family member or friend wants a picture or video of themselves removed from the internet, will those requests be honored?
21: There are ways to show respect and kindness - both online and off. Select the ones you both want to include in your agreement:
22: Technology let us do so many awesome activities. (CHILD'S) device can be used for:
23: There is so much information online, but not all of its meant for kids. Which content is appropriate for (CHILD)
28: Approximately how may hours will (CHILD) be allowed to spend with a device each day outside of school?
29: How will child budget their screen time? Use the sliders to show what percentage of (CHILD) screen time will be devoted to various activities.
30: What types of content makes (CHILD) uncomfortable?
31: What type of content is (ADULT) uncomfortable with (CHILD) seeing/hearing?
32: (CHILD) can you agree that when if you see something that doesn't make you feel good we can have a conversation about it?
33: Read reviews on a website like CommonSense Media before trying a new app, game, movie, or website
34: Close out of videos, sites or games that make us feel uncomfortable
35: Adjust content settings on our internet, cable or devices as needed
36: Create and use seperate "kid profiles" on apps like Netflix or Hulu
37: Not everything we see online is true. (CHILD), do you agree to ask a trusted adult if you have questions about what you see online?
38: What are three activities you enjoy to get your heart pumping and body moving?
40: Take stretch and movement breaks during long periods of work at a screen
41: Put screens away at least one hour before going to sleep
42: (CHILD), what are three things you do with your technology that make you feel good about yourself?
43: (ADULT), what are three things you do with your technology that make you feel good about yourself?
44: (CHILD), what are three things you do or see on your device that make you feel stressed, worried, or sad?
45: (ADULT), what are three things you do or see on a device that make you feel stressed, worried, sad, jealous, angry or other negative emotion?
46: Follow people and accounts that make us happy
47: Remove ourselves fromm digital situations that bring us down
48: Celebrate our unique qualities instead of comparing ourselves to others
49: Pay attention to how our devices make us feel; take breaks when necessary
50: Be open and honest with each other when are struggling
51: Do we think it is necessary to have device-free times or device-free zones in our home?
52: When would we like to be device-free?
53: What are device-free zones in our home?
54: We all make mistakes online from time to time! (ADULT) do you agree to use mistakes as learning oppurtunities?
55: (CHILD), when you break rules that you and (ADULT) agreed on, do you agree there needs to be a consequence?
56: If the time comes, we agree that these consequences are reasonable for our family:
57: (ADULT), how will you stay accountable for following the rules? What happens if YOU break the agreement?
